Chapter: Diversity in Living Things and their Classification

questions.question: Why have various types of living things survived on earth?

options.text: Because they do not adjust to surroundings
Due to their ability to adjust to the conditions in their surroundings

questions.answer: Due to their ability to adjust to the conditions in their surroundings

questions.question: Plants that make their own food in sunlight are called?
questions.answer: Autotrophic plants

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of autotrophic plants?
questions.answer: Hibiscus

questions.question: Plants that use other plants for food are called?
questions.answer: Heterotrophic

questions.question: Which plant consumes insects and is therefore called insectivorous?
questions.answer: Pitcher plant

questions.question: On what basis are plants classified for convenience?

options.text: Similarities and differences in their structure, organs and characteristics

questions.answer: Similarities and differences in their structure, organs and characteristics

questions.question: Which scientist made the first scientific classification of plants?
questions.answer: Carolus Linnaeus

questions.question: Which two main parts is the structure of a plant generally divided into?
questions.answer: Stem and root

questions.question: What is the primary function of the root?

options.text: To absorb and transport water and nutrients from the soil

questions.answer: To absorb and transport water and nutrients from the soil

questions.question: Which plants have taproot system?
questions.answer: Hibiscus and banyan

questions.question: Which plants have fibrous root system?
questions.answer: Onion and grass

questions.question: What is the main role of the leaf?
questions.answer: Production of food

questions.question: Which types of leaves are mentioned in the chapter?
questions.answer: Simple and compound leaves

questions.question: Example of a plant with simple leaf?
questions.answer: Hibiscus

questions.question: Which plants' roots store food?
questions.answer: Carrot and radish

questions.question: What functions does the stem perform?

options.text: Production, conduction and storage of food; support to other parts

questions.answer: Production, conduction and storage of food; support to other parts

questions.question: Which plants are examples of trees?
questions.answer: Mango, banyan and tamarind

questions.question: What characterizes trees?

options.text: Tall, hard and strong trunk with branches above ground

questions.answer: Tall, hard and strong trunk with branches above ground

questions.question: Examples of shrubs?

options.text: Oleander, hibiscus, lantana, koranti and rose

questions.answer: Oleander, hibiscus, lantana, koranti and rose

questions.question: What is the height range of shrubs?
questions.answer: Two to three metres

questions.question: Which plants are herbs?
questions.answer: Fenugreek and periwinkle

questions.question: Characteristics of herbs' stems?
questions.answer: Green and quite flexible

questions.question: Height of herbs?
questions.answer: 1 to 1.5 metres tall

questions.question: Which vines need vertical support for growing?
questions.answer: Climbers like money plant

questions.question: What characterizes the stem of a creeper?
questions.answer: Very flexible, soft and green

questions.question: Examples of vines mentioned?

options.text: Pumpkin, railroad creeper, kavali, watermelon, grapevine

questions.answer: Pumpkin, railroad creeper, kavali, watermelon, grapevine

questions.question: What are annual plants?
questions.answer: Lifecycle completed in one year

questions.question: Examples of annual plants?
questions.answer: Jowar, sunflower

questions.question: What are biennial plants?
questions.answer: Lifecycle of two years

questions.question: Examples of biennial plants?
questions.answer: Carrot, beetroot

questions.question: What are perennial plants?

options.text: Live for several years and bear flowers and fruit

questions.answer: Live for several years and bear flowers and fruit

questions.question: Plants that bear flowers are called?
questions.answer: Flowering plants

questions.question: Non-flowering plants may lack?
questions.answer: Organs like roots, stems, leaves

questions.question: What is the world's largest flower?
questions.answer: Rafflesia arnoldi

questions.question: Where is the world's largest flower found?
questions.answer: Indonesia

questions.question: What is the diameter of Rafflesia arnoldi flower?
questions.answer: About one metre

questions.question: What is the world's smallest flower?
questions.answer: Wolffia or duckweed

questions.question: Diameter of the world's smallest flower?
questions.answer: As small as 0.5 mm

questions.question: Various habitats of plants include?

options.text: Land, water, marshy areas, deserts and even a big tree

questions.answer: Land, water, marshy areas, deserts and even a big tree

questions.question: Where does the lotus grow?
questions.answer: Water

questions.question: Where does the pomegranate shrub grow?
questions.answer: Land

questions.question: Where does dodder plant grow?
questions.answer: On other plants

questions.question: Why does water hyacinth float on water?

options.text: It has air-filled spaces in stems

questions.answer: It has air-filled spaces in stems

questions.question: Why is the stem of cactus fleshy?
questions.answer: To store water

questions.question: Which is a unicellular animal seen under microscope in puddle water?
questions.answer: Amoeba

questions.question: Another unicellular animal like amoeba?
questions.answer: Paramoecium

questions.question: Examples of multicellular animals?
questions.answer: Horse, bear, tortoise

questions.question: Animals with vertebral column are called?
questions.answer: Vertebrates

questions.question: Examples of vertebrates?
questions.answer: Snakes, birds, fish, kangaroos, humans

questions.question: Examples of invertebrates?
questions.answer: Snails, cockroaches, earthworms

questions.question: Why do living things exist in diverse geographical conditions?
questions.answer: Various types of living things have survived because of their ability to adjust themselves to the conditions in their surroundings.

questions.question: Define autotrophic plants.
questions.answer: Autotrophic plants are those that make their own food in sunlight.

questions.question: Give examples of heterotrophic plants.
questions.answer: Funguses, loranthus and dodder are heterotrophic plants that use other plants for food.

questions.question: What are insectivorous plants?
questions.answer: Insectivorous plants like the pitcher plant consume insects.

questions.question: Why is classification of plants necessary?
questions.answer: Classification of plants is necessary for convenience while studying the diversity, based on similarities and differences in structure, organs and other characteristics.

questions.question: Name the main parts of a plant.
questions.answer: The root, stem and leaves are the main parts of plants.

questions.question: Functions of roots.
questions.answer: Roots hold the soil firmly and anchor the plant, absorb and transport water and nutrients from the soil, and in some like carrot and radish, store food.

questions.question: Types of roots mentioned.
questions.answer: There are two types of roots: taproot and fibrous root.

questions.question: Role of leaves in plants.
questions.answer: The leaf is flat and plays an important role in the production of food.

questions.question: Types of leaves.
questions.answer: Leaves are mainly of two types: simple and compound leaves.

questions.question: Function of the stem.
questions.answer: The stem carries out production, conduction and storage of food, gives support to other parts of the plant and in some plants, functions in reproduction.

questions.question: Role of flowers in plants.
questions.answer: The flower is an important means of reproduction.

questions.question: What do fruits contain?
questions.answer: Fruits contain one or more seeds.

questions.question: Example of fruits that are pods.
questions.answer: The pods of beans and peas are actually fruits.

questions.question: Characteristics of trees.
questions.answer: Trees are tall, big and perennial plants with hard and strong trunk and branches at some height above the ground, bearing flowers and fruit for many years.

questions.question: Characteristics of shrubs.
questions.answer: Shrubs grow close to the ground, give out branches very close to the ground, are shorter and smaller than trees but have thick and hard stem.

questions.question: Characteristics of herbs.
questions.answer: Herbs grow 1 to 1.5 metres tall with green and quite flexible stems, and may live for a few months or up to two years.

questions.question: Difference between climbers and creepers.
questions.answer: Climbers like money plant need vertical support and have aerial roots, while creepers spread on the ground or grow rapidly with support and have very flexible, soft and green stems.

questions.question: What are tendrils used for in cucumber?
questions.answer: Tendrils in cucumber are used to grasp support for growing.

questions.question: Define annual plants.
questions.answer: Annual plants are those whose lifecycle is completed in one year, like jowar and sunflower.

questions.question: Define biennial plants.
questions.answer: Biennial plants have a lifecycle of two years, like carrot and beetroot.

questions.question: Define perennial plants.
questions.answer: Perennial plants like shrubs such as hibiscus and oleander, and trees like mango and gulmohur live for several years and bear flowers and fruit.

questions.question: Differentiate flowering and non-flowering plants.
questions.answer: Flowering plants bear flowers, while non-flowering plants never bear flowers and may not have organs like roots, stems or leaves.

questions.question: Name the world's largest flower and its diameter.
questions.answer: The world's largest flower is Rafflesia arnoldi with diameter about one metre.

questions.question: Name the world's smallest flower and its diameter.
questions.answer: The world's smallest flower is Wolffia or duckweed with diameter as small as 0.5 mm.

questions.question: List habitats of plants.
questions.answer: Land, water, marshy areas, deserts and even a big tree are various habitats of plants.

questions.question: Where do bulrushes and railroad creeper grow?
questions.answer: Bulrushes and railroad creeper grow in water or marshy areas.

questions.question: Adaptation of water hyacinth.
questions.answer: Water hyacinth floats on water due to air-filled spaces.

questions.question: Adaptation of cactus stem.
questions.answer: The stem of cactus is fleshy to store water.

questions.question: What animals can be seen under microscope in puddle water?
questions.answer: Innumerable microbes, amoeba and paramoecium can be seen under microscope in a drop of puddle water.

questions.question: Examples of multicellular animals.
questions.answer: Horse, bear and tortoise are multicellular animals.

questions.question: What is the vertebral column?
questions.answer: The vertebral column is the chain of bones in the centre of our back.

questions.question: Define vertebrates.
questions.answer: Animals with a vertebral column are called vertebrates.

questions.question: Define invertebrates.
questions.answer: Animals without a vertebral column are called invertebrates.

questions.question: Examples of oviparous animals.
questions.answer: Oviparous animals lay eggs, such as hen.

questions.question: Examples of viviparous animals.
questions.answer: Viviparous animals give birth to their young ones, such as cow.

questions.question: Classify animals based on habitat: frog.
questions.answer: Frog is amphibious as it lives both on land and water.

questions.question: Animals with aerial mode of life.
questions.answer: Kite, eagle, crow, butterfly and honeybee have aerial mode of life as they fly in the air.

questions.question: Diversity in animals' body structure.
questions.answer: Animals have body parts like head, neck, torso, tail and limbs for movement, and various organ systems for functions.

questions.question: Reason for diversity in animals' food habits.
questions.answer: Different animals have different methods of obtaining and eating food, leading to differences in body structure.

questions.question: Why are not all animals seen in one's surroundings?
questions.answer: Not all animals are seen in one's surroundings because they live in different habitats where food is available.

questions.question: What protects the bodies of animals?
questions.answer: The bodies of animals are protected by skin, scales, feathers, hair or shells.

questions.question: Terrestrial animals.
questions.answer: Terrestrial animals live on land.

questions.question: Aquatic animals.
questions.answer: Aquatic animals live in water.

questions.question: Amphibious animals.
questions.answer: Amphibious animals like frog live both on land and water.

questions.question: Criteria for classifying plants.
questions.answer: Plants are classified on the basis of height and shape of stems, period of life cycle and habitat.

questions.question: Criteria for classifying animals.
questions.answer: Animals are classified on the basis of cell structure, vertebral column, method of reproduction and habitat.

questions.question: Importance of diversity in living world.
questions.answer: Every plant and animal is unique, and we should make efforts to conserve this diversity in the living world.

questions.question: Activity for plant classification.
questions.answer: Visit a plant nursery and classify the plants there.

questions.question: Activity for animal diversity.
questions.answer: Visit a zoo and obtain information about the diversity in animals.

questions.question: How to observe microbes?
questions.answer: Take a drop of water from a puddle, place on glass slide and observe under microscope.

questions.question: Diversity in plant height.
questions.answer: Some plants like grass are short, others are tall with canopy.

questions.question: Variety within same plant type.
questions.answer: Different varieties of rice or wheat, different types of roses, mangoes of different flavours.

questions.question: Plants without stems, leaves or roots.
questions.answer: Some plants grow even without stems, leaves or roots and are very different from ordinary plants.

questions.question: Role of flowers in reproduction.
questions.answer: Plants bear flowers for reproduction, which transform into fruits containing seeds.

questions.question: Observation activity for plants.
questions.answer: Take a round through garden or surroundings, list plants, draw pictures and complete table on nature, height, branches, leaves, flowers, fruits and uses.

questions.question: Lifecycle of crops like bajra, wheat, corn.
questions.answer: Crops like bajra, wheat, corn, radish, marigold live for one or two years.

questions.question: Plants attractive to butterflies and insects.
questions.answer: Butterflies and insects are attracted to flowers of plants.

questions.question: Non-flowering plants examples.
questions.answer: Toadstools, mushrooms, ferns, algae.

questions.question: Flowering or not: money plant.
questions.answer: Money plant does not bear flowers.

questions.question: Habitat classification: lotus.
questions.answer: Lotus grows in water.

questions.question: Habitat classification: bulrushes.
questions.answer: Bulrushes grow in water or marshy areas.

questions.question: Habitat of dodder.
questions.answer: Dodder grows on other plants.

questions.question: Diversity in animals examples.
questions.answer: Amoeba, elephant, snail, fish, kite, butterfly, house lizard.

questions.question: Variety in animals' body structure.
questions.options: Snake, lizard, tiger, fish, eagle, hen, crab, housefly, earthworm, crocodile, grasshopper.

questions.question: Observation activity for animals.
questions.answer: Observe animals in surroundings, list names, complete table on food, eating method, habitat and special features.

questions.question: Websites for animal information.
questions.answer: www.earthlife.net, www.discovery.com, www.seaworld.org, www.kidsgowild.com, www.worldwildlife.org, www.nationalgeographic.com.

questions.question: Oviparous reproduction.
questions.answer: Oviparous animals lay eggs, young ones hatch out of eggs.

questions.question: Viviparous reproduction.
questions.answer: Viviparous animals give birth to young ones after they grow within the body.

questions.question: Amphibious animals examples.
questions.answer: Frog, salamander, toad.

questions.question: Aerial animals examples.
questions.answer: Kite, eagle, crow, butterfly, honeybee.

questions.question: Essay activity.
questions.answer: Write an essay on diversity in plants.

questions.question: Seed collection activity.
questions.answer: Collect seeds of various plants during summer and throw them in open spaces during rainy season.

questions.question: Draw figure activity.
questions.answer: Draw figure of a plant showing root, stem and leaves.

questions.question: Odd one out: fungus, mushroom, chrysanthemum, spirogyra.
questions.answer: Chrysanthemum, because others are non-flowering.

questions.question: Odd one out: mango, banyan, palm, chick pea.
questions.answer: Chick pea, because others are trees.

questions.question: Difference: tree and shrub.
questions.answer: Trees are tall with hard trunk and branches high up, shrubs are shorter with thick hard stem and branches close to ground.

questions.question: Difference: vertebrates and invertebrates.
questions.answer: Vertebrates have vertebral column, invertebrates do not.

questions.question: True or false: snail is aquatic.
questions.answer: False, snail is terrestrial.

questions.question: True or false: amphibians live in air and water.
questions.answer: True.

questions.question: Name a flowering plant.
questions.answer: Rose.

questions.question: Name a non-flowering plant.
questions.answer: Fern.

questions.question: Name a creeper.
questions.answer: Pumpkin.

questions.question: Name an annual plant.
questions.answer: Jowar.

questions.question: Characteristics of creepers.
questions.answer: Creepers have very flexible, soft and green stem, grow rapidly with help of support.

questions.question: Explain herbs with examples.
questions.answer: Herbs grow 1 to 1.5 m tall with green flexible stems, e.g., fenugreek, periwinkle.

questions.question: Criteria for classifying plants and animals.
questions.answer: Height/shape of stems, lifecycle period, habitat for plants; cell structure, vertebral column, reproduction, habitat for animals.

questions.question: Match: amphibian - frog.
questions.answer: Amphibian: frog.

questions.question: Match: vertebrate - monkey.
questions.answer: Vertebrate: monkey.

questions.question: Match: with scales - snake.
questions.answer: With scales: snake.

questions.question: Odd one out: grape, orange, lemon, hibiscus.
questions.answer: Hibiscus, because others bear fruits.

questions.question: Odd one out: sunflower, banyan, jowar, bajra.
questions.answer: Banyan, because others are annuals.

questions.question: Odd one out: guava, radish, carrot, beetroot.
questions.answer: Guava, because others have storage roots.

questions.question: Odd one out: deer, fish, man, worms.
questions.answer: Worms, because others are vertebrates.

questions.question: Difference: flowering and non-flowering plants.
questions.answer: Flowering plants bear flowers for reproduction, non-flowering do not and may lack roots, stems, leaves.

questions.question: Name a tree.
questions.answer: Mango.

questions.question: Name a shrub.
questions.answer: Rose.

questions.question: Perennial plant example.
questions.answer: Gulmohur.

questions.question: Biennial plant example.
questions.answer: Radish.

questions.question: Why classify living things?
questions.answer: Classification is necessary to study diversity conveniently based on similarities and differences.
